WorkItem.Description: When using the Build Upgrade List feature, the list grades upgrades by how much they will improve the first slot for rings and trinkets.  The upgrade value over items in the second slot appears to be ignored.
WorkItem.Summary: Build Upgrade List doesn't consider both slots for rings and trinkets

Comments.Message: The optimizer puts your "better" ring/trinket in the first slot. So if you upgrade your ring/trinket, you put it in the 2nd spot.

The Upgrade List is a list of potential upgrades, not items that I have available.  If my best trinket is in Slot 1 (which it is), shouldn't the items listed in the Upgrade List be compared to my worse trinket, the one in Slot 2?  After all, that's the one I'm going to replace upon getting the new item.  What is happening instead is that the Upgrade List is showing me the value of upgrading my "better" trinket, ignoring the worse trinket in slot 2.

Sorry, I clearly underestimated the number of developers Astrylian has roped into helping him :)

Here's a link to the discussion thread where I provided more details about this issue: http://rawr.codeplex.com/Thread/View.aspx?ThreadId=56943
